alert.note: Alert for Dickens (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 25 at 9:59PM CDT until April 25 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL DICKENS COUNTY... At 959 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 4 miles west-northwest of Dickens, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Dickens. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
